meanings.definition: Having more hooks or hooks of a higher quality.
meanings.sent1: The new fishing lure was hookier than the old one.
meanings.sent2: The coat rack with more hooks is hookier than the one with fewer hooks.
meanings.sent3: The pirate's parrot joked that its beak was hookier than the captain's sword.
meanings.sent4: Her catchy song had a hookier melody than any other on the radio.
meanings.sent5: The velcro was so hookier that it stuck to everything in sight.

meanings.definition: Tending to use hooks or engage in hooking activities.
meanings.sent1: The fisherman's hands were calloused from his hookier lifestyle.
meanings.sent2: The hookier approach to marketing proved to be more successful.
meanings.sent3: The crochet club was known for their hookier sense of humor.
meanings.sent4: Her persuasive speech had a hookier effect on the audience.
meanings.sent5: The locksmith's job required a hookier skill set than most people realized.
